alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 04 at 2:42AM CDT until April 05 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED OVER VAL VERDE COUNTY ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON, AND MOST OF SOUTH-CENTRAL TEXAS WEDNESDAY MORNING AND AFTERNOON... Very dry air will filter into portions of the southern Edwards Plateau this afternoon, with humidity values in the single digits and lower teens currently forecast for Val Verde County. Combined with afternoon winds of 20 to 30 mph possibly gusting to 40 mph, dry to critically dry fuels all allow for the efficient spread of fires. A Red Flag Warning has been issued, effective from 1-7 PM CDT for Val Verde County. A cold front will push in from the northwest late tonight into Wednesday morning. Very dry air will overspread the region behind the boundary, with widespread relative humidities in the teens and single digits forecast along and west of the Interstate 35 Corridor. Combined with sustained north winds ranging from 15 to 25 MPH, and dry to critically dry fuels, this will promote additional critical fire weather conditions across this portion of South-Central Texas. A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for all counties along and west of I-35, effective from 4 AM to 4 PM CDT Wednesday. Avoid any activities that could inadvertently promote the ignition and spread of wildfires on both Tuesday and Wednesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR VAL VERDE COUNTY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY OVER THE INTERSTATE 35 CORRIDOR...HILL COUNTRY...SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 6 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
